column2: That's all I'm saying  that his math is wrong, it's been welldocumented that if all the bills were paid at Medicare rate, which is specifically  I think it's in section 1,200 of their bill, then many hospitals in this country would close.
column4: If you go to every hospital in this country and you ask them one question, which is, How would it have been for you last year if every one of your bills were paid at the Medicare rate? Every single hospital administrator said they would close.

column2: I've been going around rural America, and I ask rural hospital administrators one question, "If all your bills were paid at the Medicare rate last year, what would happen?"
column4: If you go to every hospital in this country and you ask them one question, which is, How would it have been for you last year if every one of your bills were paid at the Medicare rate? Every single hospital administrator said they would close.

column2: And they all look at me and say, "We would close."

column2: So the problem is that, right now, the criminalization statute is what gives Donald Trump the ability to take children away from their parents.
column4: Says that the George W. Bush administration in 2005 revived a longstanding law when it "decided to charge those that crossed the border with criminal violations, rather than civil ones."

column2: Right now, we have a dysfunctional health care system
